author: jimmygchen
content:
I've been getting this error when running `kurtosis` & `ethereum-package` locally. Is anyone else having the same issue? or is there something I need to update on my end? looks like there's a mismatch in config name:

```
Adding service with name 'dora' and image 'ethpandaops/dora:latest'
There was an error executing Starlark code
An error occurred executing instruction (number 53) at github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package/src/dora/dora_launcher.star[100:21]:
  add_service(name="dora", config=ServiceConfig(image="ethpandaops/dora:latest", ports={"http": PortSpec(number=8080, transport_protocol="TCP", application_protocol="http")}, public_ports={}, files={"/config": "dora-config", "/validator-ranges": "validator-ranges"}, cmd=["-config", "/config/dora-config.yaml"], env_vars={}, max_cpu=1000, min_cpu=100, max_memory=2048, min_memory=128, node_selectors={}))
  Caused by: Unexpected error occurred starting service 'dora'
  Caused by: An error occurred waiting for all TCP and UDP ports to be open for service 'dora' with private IP '172.16.0.19'; this is usually due to a misconfiguration in the service itself, so here are the logs:
  == SERVICE 'dora' LOGS ===================================
  time="2024-08-28T00:30:15Z" level=fatal msg="error reading config file: tried to set known chain-config, but unknown chain-name"

  == FINISHED SERVICE 'dora' LOGS ===================================
  Caused by: An error occurred while waiting for all TCP and UDP ports to be open
  Caused by: Unsuccessful ports check for IP '172.16.0.19' and port spec '{privatePortSpec:0xc000ab6840}', even after '240' retries with '500' milliseconds in between retries. Timeout '2m0s' has been reached
  Caused by: An error occurred while calling network address '172.16.0.19:8080' with port protocol 'TCP' and using time out '200ms'
  Caused by: dial tcp 172.16.0.19:8080: i/o timeout

Error encountered running Starlark code.
```

author: jimmygchen
content: oh it works fine if I use the 4.2.0 tag. Seems to be related to the change in this PR: https://github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package/pull/748

author: parithosh
content: Do you usually work off of pinned releases?

author: jimmygchen
content: nah i usually just use the latest without any commit / tag ðŸ˜…

author: jimmygchen
content: Is this a known issue? I can raise an issue on the repo if it's not already fixed

author: parithosh
content: not yet, we'll look into it in a bit and get back to you!

author: parithosh
content: so using ethpandaops/ethereum-package breaks and leads to the error and using v4.2.0 works? if so could you send us the kurtosis config you used?

author: barnabasbusa
content: are you running with latest dora image?

author: barnabasbusa
content: can you run with `--image-download always` most likely you have an older dora:latest image cached locally

author: pk910
content: yea,  it pretty much sounds like an old image, because all that chain config stuff, incl. the error message you posted is no longer there in the latest release

author: jimmygchen
content: Ah right, that makes sense . Maybe itâ€™s just an old image! Iâ€™ll test it out tomorrow

author: jimmygchen
content: Is it worth pinning the image versions in the package too?

author: barnabasbusa
content: I think that would be a pain

author: barnabasbusa
content: We recommend ppl to just not use local images

author: barnabasbusa
content: it adds about 3/4 sec extra each time to check if you are on latest
